snippet.textDisplay: The original being my favorite 2D Zelda, I was cautiously excited for this remake. It looked great, but I couldn't shake the feeling the original's atmosphere might get lost starting with the music. The Face Shrine is the perfect theme to check if the unique ambience is retained and I can only be happy with the result. Nagamatsu obviously had respect for this particular theme with his awesome decision to keep the original's motif Gameboy-style. I'm now officially hyped to go through this adventure once again.
snippet.textOriginal: The original being my favorite 2D Zelda, I was cautiously excited for this remake. It looked great, but I couldn't shake the feeling the original's atmosphere might get lost starting with the music. The Face Shrine is the perfect theme to check if the unique ambience is retained and I can only be happy with the result. Nagamatsu obviously had respect for this particular theme with his awesome decision to keep the original's motif Gameboy-style. I'm now officially hyped to go through this adventure once again.

snippet.textDisplay: I ran into this theme yesterday and I was immediately impressed (never played the original). I also love soundtracks in general and your channel is the perfect place to keep the love alive. Keep up the great work!
snippet.textOriginal: I ran into this theme yesterday and I was immediately impressed (never played the original). I also love soundtracks in general and your channel is the perfect place to keep the love alive. Keep up the great work!

snippet.textDisplay: I agree, I found this theme yesterday, most of the other castle themes are just updated versions of the original. This one however increases the depth of feeling found after you learn the truth. The only complaint I have is that the new music should have lowered in volume when the chiptune sections began, the original sounds get lost in the new sounds.

snippet.textDisplay: It's just a square lead, I'd prefer something better-sounding than what's in there. I mean a nicer square lead.  Keeping a similarly-timed delay effect would suffice to keep the "ambience", apart from the same arp sequence, which is present.

snippet.textDisplay:
After finding out the truth about Koholint Island, you don't want to leave but it must be done.

The Wind Fish must awaken, even if it hurts to do so.

snippet.textDisplay: Best piece 👌👌
snippet.textOriginal: Best piece 👌👌

snippet.textDisplay:
The Face Shrines are the turning point in the game. Not many other game cameos or whimsical moments after this (unless you haven't got the frog song yet, I guess) and every interaction with major characters is touched by sadness. This song hits like a truck. And it's one of the few that uses the original 8 bit sound. 

Also there's this weird feeling that comes with smashing those big statues, like you're shattering the illusion.
snippet.textOriginal:
The Face Shrines are the turning point in the game. Not many other game cameos or whimsical moments after this (unless you haven't got the frog song yet, I guess) and every interaction with major characters is touched by sadness. This song hits like a truck. And it's one of the few that uses the original 8 bit sound. 

Also there's this weird feeling that comes with smashing those big statues, like you're shattering the illusion.

snippet.textDisplay: It's like you're walking through a dark, quiet city after hearing about creepy happenings happening, and you find out the truth that you can't do anything about it because you have nothing you CAN do about it. As you leave town, you notice the creepy happenings, well, happening around you, and all you can do is keep walking.
snippet.textOriginal: It's like you're walking through a dark, quiet city after hearing about creepy happenings happening, and you find out the truth that you can't do anything about it because you have nothing you CAN do about it. As you leave town, you notice the creepy happenings, well, happening around you, and all you can do is keep walking.

snippet.textDisplay: Who wouldn't after just learning your course of action will literally result in the end of the world as you know it... It's a real tragedy :(
snippet.textOriginal: Who wouldn't after just learning your course of action will literally result in the end of the world as you know it... It's a real tragedy :(

snippet.textDisplay:
This song feels like so many things. A tragedy. A terrible truth. Pain in a hero's heart, but unshakeable resolve pushes him onward. The Wind Fish must awaken. *He* must awaken. It is the nature of dreams to end...

No matter how lovely they are.
snippet.textOriginal:
This song feels like so many things. A tragedy. A terrible truth. Pain in a hero's heart, but unshakeable resolve pushes him onward. The Wind Fish must awaken. *He* must awaken. It is the nature of dreams to end...

No matter how lovely they are.

@some pizza guy oh yea ALBW and minish cap are both not main line games, they are sure first party zelda games but not main developmenet studio / main line, just as this. Inferiority is as well not the point here. 
I´m not talking about some opinion if one finds it overprized and one might not I´m talking about the facts here. Remake. Short. Not Mainline. The price is that high because Nintendo knows people will buy it and tbf its half a day of work payment so nothing I could not buy or I just wait 2-3 years till the game has a reasonable price of 30-20 money I would have even understood a launch price of 40 but paying the same then other first party nintendo games is just unacceptable

snippet.textDisplay:
@Agarillo Bob The top down Zelda games are "main line", too, like A Link Between Worlds and Minish Cap. Perspective shouldn't change a price. Link's Awakening really isn't that short, and I don't think there is even one short canon Zelda game. Saying it's the shortest compared to other Zelda titles doesn't mean much.. Also, there seem to be some added collectibles in the remake that would add to the length of the original. 
Handheld games are really only inferior to home console games graphically (though the Game Boy has the limitation of not having many buttons). Whether this remake is overpriced or not depends on the consumer. Some people may think the game is long enough while other might not, and some might finish the game faster than others. Some people only want to beat the story and don't want to get any collectibles or do any side quest. So I think it is not overpriced, at least for some people.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Agarillo Bob The top down Zelda games are "main line", too, like A Link Between Worlds and Minish Cap. Perspective shouldn't change a price. Link's Awakening really isn't that short, and I don't think there is even one short canon Zelda game. Saying it's the shortest compared to other Zelda titles doesn't mean much.. Also, there seem to be some added collectibles in the remake that would add to the length of the original. 
Handheld games are really only inferior to home console games graphically (though the Game Boy has the limitation of not having many buttons). Whether this remake is overpriced or not depends on the consumer. Some people may think the game is long enough while other might not, and some might finish the game faster than others. Some people only want to beat the story and don't want to get any collectibles or do any side quest. So I think it is not overpriced, at least for some people.

I would estimate at least 40 hours for people who haven't played the game before.
